protein.specific_function: Mitochondrial iron transporter that specifically mediates iron uptake in developing erythroid cells, thereby playing an essential role in heme biosynthesis. The iron delivered into the mitochondria, presumably as Fe(2+), is then probably delivered to ferrochelatase to catalyze Fe(2+) incorporation into protoprophyrin IX to make heme

reference.reference_text: Li QZ, Eckenrode S, Ruan QG, Wang CY, Shi JD, McIndoe RA, She JX: Rapid decrease of RNA level of a novel mouse mitochondria solute carrier protein (Mscp) gene at 4-5 weeks of age. Mamm Genome. 2001 Nov;12(11):830-6.
